alert.note: Alert for Bath; Estill; Fleming; Lee; Montgomery (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 6:21PM EST until February 17 at 6:45PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in east central Kentucky, Bath, Estill, Fleming, Menifee, Montgomery, Powell and Rowan. In southeast Kentucky, Lee, Owsley and Wolfe. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 611 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms. Rainfall amounts through 6 pm across the area have ranged from 0.75 to 1.5 inches. Up to another inch of rainfall is expected to fall between 6 and 8 pm. Excessive runoff will cause minor flooding of creeks and streams, roads, and roadside culverts. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Sterling, Morehead, Stanton, Irvine, Flemingsburg, Owingsville, Frenchburg, Marshall, Jeffersonville, Camargo, Clay City, Ravenna, Sharpsburg, Salt Lick, Campsites in the Indian Creek area of the Daniel Boone National Forrest, Fairview, Hope, Walkers Crossing, Clay Lick and Peeled Oak. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
